column4: Soren: I do it by number of characters in a filename. Just my preference.
Last shot. Anyone interested in a syslog-ng problem before I leave for the day?
NP. was a while ago. Used http://www.quietearth.us/articles/2006/09/27/Logging-remote-host-to-specific-logfile-with-syslogng to set up a router logging to my 9.04 server.
could you please pastebin your syslog-ng.conf?
okay, you still need to tell syslog-ng to listen on the port
i see you made a whole new source, but have you verified it's listening?
thought that my lines 96 overrode 91-93 .... uncommented anyway.
aaah okay - i see what happened - you created a source but you never plugged it into anything at the bottom of the config
uncommenting line 93 and restarted didn't help ..... reading your new comment now.
if you search for s_all, you'll see where it's used - and note that s_net is not
i bet, if you comment out s_net, it'll start working - the s_net and s_all are clobbering each other, which is probably why it isn't working just yet
